metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20372 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
NGINX before 1.17.7, with certain error_page configurations, allows HTTPrequest smuggling, as demonstrated by the ability of an attacker to readunauthorized web pages in environments where NGINX is being fronted by aload balancer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20372` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm1
nginx-common - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm1
nginx-core - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm1
nginx-extras - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm1
nginx-full - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm1
nginx-light - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm1
nginx-naxsi - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm1
nginx-naxsi-ui - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nginx package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm1').
